channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: GSA staff faces massive cuts. And, could NASA launch a Mars mission?
item.description: The General Services Administration plans to cut its budget in half and ramp up monitoring of staff. And, Elon Musk could help propel a NASA Mars program — or delay it for another generation.
item.content:encoded:
The General Services Administration plans to cut its budget in half and ramp up monitoring of staff. And, Elon Musk could help propel a NASA Mars program — or delay it for another generation.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Republicans split on best path to advance Trump's agenda in Congress
item.description: Republicans may control both chambers of Congress but leaders in the House and Senate have very different ideas about the best way to implement President Trump's agenda.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans may control both chambers of Congress but leaders in the House and Senate have very different ideas about the best way to implement President Trump's agenda.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Trump funding freeze could leave communities on their own as climate threats grow
item.description: Without federal support, American communities will struggle to deal with a challenge as pervasive as climate change, market analysts and environmental advocates say.
item.content:encoded:
Without federal support, American communities will struggle to deal with a challenge as pervasive as climate change, market analysts and environmental advocates say.

(Image credit: Al Drago/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: Trump official targeting Jan. 6 investigators worked on those cases himself
item.description: The disconnect between Bove's aggressive stance at the time to hold rioters accountable — and his current hostility towards the Jan. 6 probe — has troubled some former colleagues.
item.content:encoded:
The disconnect between Bove's aggressive stance at the time to hold rioters accountable — and his current hostility towards the Jan. 6 probe — has troubled some former colleagues.

(Image credit: Jeenah Moon-Pool)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: She wanted to be a mom. So she chose a cancer treatment that gave her a chance
item.description: New, less damaging treatments are giving some patients the choice to try to preserve their ability to have children after cancer.
item.content:encoded: New, less damaging treatments are giving some patients the choice to try to preserve their ability to have children after cancer.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Elon Musk's DOGE takes aim at agency that had plans of regulating X
item.description: Musk and other Silicon Valley executives have long railed against the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau for its work overseeing the tech industry. Now, Musk hopes to eliminate the agency.
item.content:encoded:
Musk and other Silicon Valley executives have long railed against the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau for its work overseeing the tech industry. Now, Musk hopes to eliminate the agency.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: When her young son was hit by a pickup truck, a stranger ran over to help
item.description: Melissa Barbanell's 7-year-old son was severely injured after being hit by a pickup truck. A stranger, who turned out to be a nurse, let Barbanell know he was going to be OK.
item.content:encoded:
Melissa Barbanell's 7-year-old son was severely injured after being hit by a pickup truck. A stranger, who turned out to be a nurse, let Barbanell know he was going to be OK.

(Image credit: Melissa Barbanell)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Katz

item.title: Top Trump administration officials visiting Europe this week
item.description: Top Trump administration officials are in Europe this week, with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth attending his first NATO meeting and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Paris to discuss Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Top Trump administration officials are in Europe this week, with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth attending his first NATO meeting and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Paris to discuss Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: What it would take to send people to Mars
item.description: Proponents of going to Mars see peril and opportunity in Elon Musk's close relationship with Trump. Experts say just getting Americans back to the moon in the near future will be challenging enough.
item.content:encoded: Proponents of going to Mars see peril and opportunity in Elon Musk's close relationship with Trump. Experts say just getting Americans back to the moon in the near future will be challenging enough.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Trump ally Steve Bannon pleads guilty and avoids jail time in border wall fraud case
item.description: Bannon pleaded guilty in a Manhattan court to one count of scheme to defraud, a low-level felony. The case involved We Build the Wall, a non-profit that Bannon himself once suspected was a scam.
item.content:encoded:
Bannon pleaded guilty in a Manhattan court to one count of scheme to defraud, a low-level felony. The case involved We Build the Wall, a non-profit that Bannon himself once suspected was a scam.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
